meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the control of the importation of plants, plant pests and soil, for the prevention of the spread of plant pests and for matters incidental to and connected therewith.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Plant (Importation and Pest Control) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a public officer authorized by the Director under section 3;
Director (署長) means the Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation; (Amended L.N. 331 of 1999)
import (進口), in relation to a plant, plant pest or soil, means to bring, or cause to be brought, into Hong Kong any plant, plant pest or soil by land, air or water or through the post;

in transit (過境), in relation to a plant, plant pest or soil, means a plant, plant pest or soil which is brought into Hong Kong solely for the purpose of taking it or causing it to be taken out of Hong Kong;
phytosanitary certificate (植物檢疫證明書) means a phytosanitary certificate referred to in section 6(2);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: timber, trees and shrubs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leaves, roots, flowers, fruit, tubers, bulbs, corms, stocks, cuttings, layers, slips, suckers, seeds, and any part of a plant, whether or not intended for growing, planting or propagation or from which further plants may be grown, planted or propagated;

section.def: plant import licence (植物進口證) means a licence referred to in section 6(1);
plant pest (植物病蟲害) means any bacterium, fungus, virus, mycoplasma, alga or other plant or any invertebrate animal which is capable of being injurious or destructive to plants;

prohibited (受禁制), in relation to a plant, plant pest or soil, means any plant, plant pest or soil the importation of which is not permitted except in accordance with and subject to the terms and conditions of a plant import licence or a written authorization of the Director;
quarantine area (檢疫區) means an area declared under section 14 to be a quarantine area;
soil (泥土) includes earth, sand, clay and peat.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Appointment of authorized officers
section.content: The Director may authorize in writing any public officer to exercise any of the powers and perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on an authorized officer by this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prohibition of importation of certain plant

subsection.leadIn: No person shall import any plant specified in the first column of Part I of the First Schedule from any country specified opposite thereto in the second column of that Part, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is imported subject to the conditions (if any) of a plant import licence issued in respect thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been fumigated or disinfected in the country of its origin;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a valid phytosanitary certificate which certifies that the plant is free from the plant pest specified in relation to such plant in the last part of the second column of the relevant item in Part I of the First Schedule; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is imported subject to the condition that every such plant shall be grown in quarantine until the Director is satisfied either that it is free from plant pests or that it is diseased and must be destroyed.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall import any plant specified in the first column of Part II of the First Schedule from any country specified opposite thereto in the second column of that Part, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is imported subject to the conditions (if any) of a plant import licence issued in respect thereof;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a valid phytosanitary certificate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is imported subject to the conditions specified opposite thereto in the third column of that Part and such conditions relating to quarantine as may be specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 5, no person shall import any plant other than a plant specified in the First Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is imported subject to the conditions of a plant import licence issued in respect thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is accompanied by a valid phytosanitary certificate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any plant specified in Part I of the Second Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any plant specified in Part II of the Second Schedule if it is accompanied by a valid phytosanitary certificate.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Plant import licences and certificates, etc.

subsection.content: A plant import licence shall be in Form 1 set out in the Third Schedule and may be issued by the Director upon application made to him and subject to such conditions as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A phytosanitary certificate accompanying any plant to be imported shall not be valid for the purposes of this Ordinance unless it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: similar in substance to Form 2 set out in the Third Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: completed in English or in Chinese characters, or accompanied by a translation in English or in Chinese characters; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed, not more than 14 days prior to the date of the export of the plant from the country in which it was grown, by or on behalf of an authorized officer of the Plant Protection Service of that country.

subsection.content: The Director may, upon application made to him in such form as he may determine and upon payment of such fee as may be prescribed, examine any plant and may issue in respect of such plant a phytosanitary certificate in the form set out in Form 2 in the Third Schedule.
Phytosanitary examination of plants may be made at the premises of the applicant subject to payment of such fee as may be prescribed.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition on importing plant pests
section.content: No person shall import any plant pest or any plant infected by or infested with a plant pest, save in accordance with the terms of an authorization in writing issued to him by the Director.

subsection.content: No person shall import any soil save in accordance with the terms of an authorization in writing issued to him by the Director.
Subsection (1) shall not apply to soil imported from any place in China outside Hong Kong. (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Exemptions for plants, plant pests and soil in transit

subsection.content: This Ordinance shall not apply to any plant, plant pest or soil which is in transit, if the conditions set out in subsection (2) are complied with in respect of the plant, plant pest or soil.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the plant, plant pest or soil is packed, and remains packed, in a container which is sealed, closed or wrapped in such a manner that no plant pest may escape from the container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the container in which the plant, plant pest or soil is contained and the cargo or baggage in which the container is included—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: remain at all times on the vehicle, vessel or aircraft in which they were brought into Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if taken from such vehicle, vessel or aircraft are not removed from the place where they are brought into Hong Kong other than for the purpose of being taken out of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: If any condition set out in subsection (2) is not complied with, the Director may, unless the plant, plant pest or soil which is in transit is exported immediately or otherwise disposed of in such manner as the Director may determine, cause it to be destroyed.

The Director may recover the cost of any action taken under subsection (3) as a debt due to the Government from the person who brought or caused to be brought the plant, plant pest or soil into Hong Kong. (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Declarations concerning examination of prohibited plants etc.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person importing anything into Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person arriving in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: to declare to an authorized officer any prohibited plant, or any soil or anything which may be infected by or infested with a plant pest which that person is importing or has in his possession or under his charge.

subsection.content: The importer or the person in possession or in charge of any plant or any soil, or anything which may be infected by or infested with a plant pest referred to in subsection (1) shall, if required by the Director or an authorized officer, produce it for inspection to the Director or to an authorized officer.

An authorized officer may detain any container, package or other article, not being personal luggage, accompanying any person arriving in Hong Kong, which he has reason to believe contains any prohibited plant, a plant pest or any soil.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of examining any container, package or other article detained under subsection (3) an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person in possession or in charge to open it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: open it if such person refuses to do so.

subsection.content: If the container, package or other article is unclaimed, or if there is no person apparently in possession or in charge thereof, it may be opened on the authority of the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Where a container, package or other article is opened in accordance with subsection (5) it shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it contains no plant, plant pest or soil or if it contains plant, plant pest or soil which has been imported in accordance with this Ordinance, be returned to the custody of the airline company or shipping company which brought it into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it contains any plant, plant pest or soil which has been imported in contravention of any provision of this Ordinance, be dealt with in accordance with section 20.

subsection.content: If it is made to appear by information on oath before a magistrate that there is reasonable cause to believe that any person has in his possession or charge or on his land or premises any plant pest, the magistrate may grant a warrant to the Director or an authorized officer to enter and search for and seize any plant pest or any plant or soil believed to be infected by or infested with a plant pest.

subsection.leadIn: Where under subsection (1) a person is authorized to search land or premises for any plant pest, he may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter at any reasonable time and search the land or premises accordingly; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without further notice treat or destroy any plant pest or any plant or soil he believes to be infected by or infested with a plant pest in such manner as the Director may direct.

subsection.content: The Director may recover the cost of any action taken under subsection (2)(b) as a debt due to the Government from the person in possession or in charge of the plant pest, plant or soil. (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is satisfied that a plant pest exists in or has been introduced into Hong Kong, he may by notice direct any person who is the owner or in possession or custody of any plant or soil infected by or infested with such plant pest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to surrender the plant or soil to him without compensation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to destroy the plant pest or take such other action as is necessary to prevent its spread.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall be in such form as may be specified by the Director and shall be deemed to be served on any person if it is delivered to him personally or left for him at his last known place of residence or business or sent by post in a letter addressed to him there.

Where a notice served under section 12 is not complied with within 4 days after the day on which it was served the Director may take such steps as he thinks fit to destroy the plant pest or prevent its spread.
The Director may recover the cost of any action taken under subsection (1) as a debt due to the Government from the person served with the notice. (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Declaration of quarantine area
section.content: The Director may, by order published in the Gazette, declare any area to be a quarantine area.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Prohibition of entry into quarantine area

subsection.content: No person shall enter a quarantine area except in accordance with a permit issued by the Director or an authorized officer.
Subject to section 16(3), no person shall move any plant, plant pest or soil into or away from a quarantine area except in accordance with a permit issued by the Director or an authorized officer.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Certain plants to be grown only in quarantine area

subsection.content: The Director may, by order published in the Gazette, declare that such plants as he may specify shall, after importation, be grown or propagated only in a quarantine area.
Any plant specified under subsection (1) which is imported shall be kept in a quarantine area until such time as the Director is satisfied that it is free from plant pests.

Any person who has in his possession or charge or on his land or premises any plant specified under subsection (1), shall within 4 days of the date of the publication of the order referred to in that subsection take the plant to a quarantine area and deliver it to the officer in charge thereof.

subsection.leadIn: If any person who has in his possession or charge or on his land or premises any plant specified under subsection (1) contravenes subsection (3), the Director or an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any reasonable time enter, without a warrant, the land or premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without further notice, seize the plant and cause it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be removed and destroyed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to be removed and grown or propagated in a quarantine area.

subsection.content: The Director may recover the cost of any action taken under subsection (4)(b) as a debt due to the Government from the person in possession or in charge of the plant. (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)
The Director may charge such fees as may be prescribed in respect of the maintenance and treatment of plants which are grown or propagated in a quarantine area.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Conditions under which a plant or soil may be removed from a quarantine area

subsection.content: Any plant or soil which has undergone quarantine and treatment and which, after examination by an authorized officer, is certified by him to be free from disease and plant pest may, when all fees and incidental expenses have been duly paid, be removed from the quarantine area on the issue by the Director or an authorized officer of a permit to remove the same.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Any plant or soil which is in a quarantine area and in respect of which a permit to remove the same has been issued shall be removed by the owner within 7 days from the day on which the permit to remove was issued.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: If such plant or soil is not removed or remains unclaimed after a period of 7 days from the day on which the permit to remove was issued, the Director or an authorized officer may direct that the plant or soil shall be destroyed or otherwise disposed of in such manner as he thinks fit without liability for compensation.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Where the Director or an authorized officer is satisfied that a plant or soil is diseased and cannot be successfully treated he shall serve a notice on the owner thereof informing him of his intention to destroy such plant or soil.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The Director or an authorized officer may after 7 days of the service of the notice under paragraph (a) direct that the plant or soil shall be destroyed without liability for compensation.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: A notice under paragraph (a) shall be in such form as may be specified by the Director and shall be deemed to be served on the owner if it is delivered to him personally or left for him at his last known place of residence or business or sent by post in a letter addressed to him there.

section.name: s18
section.heading: The Government etc. not liable for damage etc. to plant in quarantine area
section.leadIn: The Government, the Director and public officers shall not be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for any damage caused to any plant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the loss of any plant,

section.continued: while the plant is being kept in, or being taken to or from, a quarantine area in accordance with this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may, for the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require a plant import licence or any document which relates to the origin of any plant, plant pest or soil to be produced to him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: examine and take copies of a plant import licence or any document referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take without payment but subject to the issue of an official receipt, such sample of any plant or soil in respect of which any plant import licence has been issued as may be required by the Director for the purpose of examination and investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine any plant or soil if he considers it necessary to do so to ascertain whether or not the provisions of this Ordinance are being, or have been, complied with by any person in respect of that plant or soil.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person to whom a plant import licence has been issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any servant, employee or agent of any person referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: to furnish such information or take such action as may be necessary to enable the authorized officer to exercise the powers conferred on him under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: When a sample of any plant or soil has been taken by an authorized officer under subsection (1)(c), the Director may, after examination and investigation, direct that the sample be returned to the owner or otherwise disposed of in such manner as the Director thinks fit.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Seizure and disposal of illegally imported plants etc.

subsection.content: An authorized officer may seize, remove and cause to be destroyed without liability for compensation, any plant imported in contravention of section 4(1).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), an authorized officer may seize without liability for compensation and remove any plant, plant pest or soil which is imported in contravention of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance other than section 4(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition of a plant import licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any authorization issued by the Director under section 7 or 8(1).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who seizes and removes any plant, plant pest or soil under subsection (2) may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause it to be treated in such manner as he thinks fit and thereafter, on payment to the Director of the appropriate prescribed fee, return it to the person from whom he seized it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without liability for compensation, destroy it or otherwise dispose of it in such manner as he thinks fit.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Director and authorized officers to be subject to the Chief Executive’s directions

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give such directions as he thinks fit, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the exercise or performance by the Director or an authorized officer, of any powers or duties under this Ordinance.

The Director and every authorized officer shall, in the exercise or performance of any powers or duties under this Ordinance, comply with any directions given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1).

Any person aggrieved by a decision, act or omission of the Director or of any authorized officer, taken, done or made in the exercise of any powers or the performance of any duties under this Ordinance may, within 14 days from the date when he was informed of the decision, act or omission or when the decision, act or omission became known to him (whichever is the later) or within such further period as the Chief Executive may allow in any particular case, by notice in writing lodge an objection to the decision, act or omission with the Chief Secretary for Administration. (Amended L.N. 226 of 1976; L.N. 362 of 1997)

On consideration of an objection lodged in accordance with subsection (1), the Chief Executive may confirm, vary or reverse the decision, act or omission of the Director or authorized officer, or substitute therefor such other decision or make such other order as he thinks fit.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Offences
section.leadIn: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of section 4, 7, 8(1), 15 or 16(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any requirement made under section 10(1), (2) or (4)(a) or section 19(l)(a) or (2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any condition imposed by virtue of section 4(1)(d) or (2)(c) or section 6(1); (Amended E.R. 4 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any direction given under section 12(1),

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Obstruction of authorized officers
section.content: Any person who obstructs an authorized officer in the exercise of any power or the performance of any duty conferred or imposed on him by this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.text: The Chief Executive may, by order published in the Gazette, amend the First, Second or Third Schedule.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Power to make regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for all or any of the following purposes— (Amended 65 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing the fees payable under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing generally for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.
